title: Metacognitive Strategies for Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Competence

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Knowledge and Problem-Solving Experience
context.additional_context: Practical mathematical problem-solving training program for job seekers. Emphasizes personalized feedback and collaborative learning environments

learning_goals: Learners accurately apply metacognitive strategies (planning-monitoring-evaluation) in diverse mathematical problem-solving contexts over 80% of the time
Learners analyze their thinking patterns during problem-solving and concretely describe improvement strategies at least three times
Learners can demonstrate transferable problem-solving skills for new mathematical problems using metacognitive strategies at least twice.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
